results.title: The Hitcher
results.creator_credit: Robert Harmon, Kip Ohman, David Bombyk and Silver Screen Partners
results.brief_description: This dark, violent suspense thriller centres around the strange psychological bond between a travelling serial killer and one of his intended victims. Travelling from Chicago to California, Jim Halsey narrowly escapes an accident when he falls asleep at the wheel. To help stay awake, he picks up hitchhiker, John Ryder, but soon discovers his error when Ryder threatens his life. Although Jim manages to escape, he is soon led on a game of cat-and-mouse across the Texas highways, where Ryder leaves a trail of corpses for Jim to discover. Cast includes Rutger Hauer, C. Thomas Howell, Jennifer Jason Leigh and Jeffrey de Munn.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Harmon, Kip Ohman, David Bombyk and Silver Screen Partners

results.title: The Hitch
results.brief_description:
A driver picks up a hitchhiker on a deserted country road but it seems neither of them knows what lies ahead.

‘The Hitch’ was shot over 6 days in the outer suburbs of Sydney, Australia. Almost all cast and crew donated their time. The budget was approximately $20,000.

results.title: The Hit
results.creator_credit: Stephen Frears, Jeremy Thomas and Zenith Productions
results.brief_description: In this early Stephen Frears feature, Terence Stamp plays Willie Parker, a philosophising mobster who adopts a tranquil life in Spain after betraying several cohorts. Ten years on they track him down, and two crims, Braddock and Myron, are charged with driving him across Spain en route to Paris where he will be assassinated. The journey is complicated by Willie’s ability to undermine Braddock (a young hot-shot, keen to impress) and Myron (a cool professional). Although tension and violence infuse the set-up, the film is marked by dark humour, and enhanced by Terence Stamp’s wry performance. Cast also includes John Hurt, Tim Roth, and Bill Hunter.

results.title: The History of writing
results.brief_description: Divided into four parts. Discusses and illustrates the origins of picture writing; the writing systems of China, Mesopotamia, and Egypt; the emergence of the first real alphabet in Palestine and Syria; the spread of this alphabet to Greece and Rome; and the development of the Roman script through the Middle Ages until the invention of printing.

results.title: The History of Totalitarianism
results.brief_description: Images are flashed in rapid succession of tyrants, artefacts and symbols of oppression from the days of Cheops to the present, to portray a quick history of man’s oppression of man. A musical score of contrasting rhythms underscores the philosophical message. Without narration.

results.title: The History of the world in three minutes flat
results.creator_credit: Michael Mills and Michael Mills Productions
results.brief_description: Uses vignettes from the past and animators’ licence to provide a humorous account of history as seen through the eyes of “The Creator”. With animation by Jim Hiltz, Bill Speers, Rick Bowman and John Gaug.

results.title: The History of the Luftwaffe
results.brief_description: After the skirmishes of WW1 armed forces fought each other in the skies for the first time, and soon planes would presage every role of future armies and navies. Upon losing the war, the size of the German armed forces was restricted, to ensure that Germany did not become a military threat in Europe. In the 1920s the desire for new technology and military designs was urgent, and following Hitler’s rise to power in the 1930s, much of the research and development was conducted clandestinely. Despite restrictions, a massive and formidable air force - The Luftwaffe - was born, and Germany’s armed forces burgeoned. This documentary uses extensive archival footage, much of it recently recovered from the East and viewed for the first time, to display these weapons of war. The role of Hitler and Hermann Goering is discussed at length, as these two warmongers contributed to the fortunes of the Luftawaffe throughout WW2. Features extensive and fascinating black and white footage of Europe from the 1910s, 20s, 30s and 40s, showing the incredible devastation of war on the land and people. Aeroplane enthusiasts, and particularly those interested in war planes, should enjoy the historical visuals and informative narrative of the various planes of the Luftwaffe.

results.title: The History of the helicopter
results.creator_credit: Sarah Erulkar and Shell Film Unit
results.brief_description: The growth of vertical flight from the early experiments of Leonardo da Vinci and others to the development of the modern helicopter. A feature of the film is a sequence made up of extracts from early newsreels.

results.title: The History of the Harley Davidson
results.creator_credit: Gary Legon, Sarah Legon and Estate Films
results.brief_description: The Harley-Davidson has legendary status. It has grown from cult appeal to mass appeal. Kids dream about them and grandparents own them. Harley is more than a motorcycle - it’s a state of mind. This program is both a history of the Harley-Davidson motorcycle and a visual feast containing fantastic shots of old, new and limited edition Harleys. Harley enthusiasts will revel in the adoration of their dream-machines, and those interested in the historical development of motor vehicles in society will be fascinated by this tribute to one of the main forms of transport. Harley loyalists run the gamut from celebrities, to librarians, to the guy down the street. Harley-Davidson will always stand for freedom, independence and the open road. Its place in history is assured. It remains, and will forever be a legend.
